active_learning.discussion_prompt: To what extent should performance baselines be standardized across organizations (e.g., using NIST SP 800-55 common measures) versus tailored to specific risk profiles? Argue your position with examples from NIST SP 800-55 and consider trade-offs in consistency, compliance (FISMA), and resource allocation.

Topic: 'Performance Baselines Establishment' (Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Security Governance Principles > Performance Management and Oversight > Performance Measurement > Performance Baselines Establishment). Consensus-approved content (100% voter approval). Core Content (Web/NIST-grounded, completed for completeness): - Performance Baselines: Predefined measures/metrics for acceptable security performance (benchmark for posture assessment/improvement). - NIST SP 800-55 Vol. 1 (Dec 2024): Guidance on developing information security measures—identifying/selecting measures for policies/controls effectiveness. - NIST SP 800-53B: Control baselines as predefined control sets (low/moderate/high impact/privacy); truncated complete: 'tailored from SP 800-53 catalog to organizational needs.' - Sources: NIST SP 800-55r1 (https://doi.org/10.6028/NIST.SP.800-55r1), SP 800-53B (https://doi.org/10.6028/NIST.SP.800-53B), FISMA. - Big Picture: Security governance oversight; compliance/resource/maturity links. Incorporate: - Learning Objectives: [paste full array above]. - Active Learning: Use scenarios/prompts (healthcare incident response, standardization debate, peer diffs: measures/metrics/baselines). - Scaffolding: Generate 5-10 cards/layer [full layers above]; tag each. - Prior Knowledge: Anchor to NIST 800-53 controls, basic KPIs. - Concept Map: Cards on central baselines → metrics/NIST docs/control baselines/risk links. Generate 30 flashcards following EXACT schema [full schema above]. Output JSON array: [{'type': '...', 'front': '...', 'back': {...}}, ...]. Ensure high-order thinking, distractors per protocol, explanations tie to objectives/activities/real-world. No violations of policy.
